image.altText: Turquoise water in a cave lake with two explorers - one is on a kayak.

props.synopsis: The Nullarbor Plain is famous for being dry, flat and featureless — but it's a very different story beneath the surface, with an intricate cave system that has remained mostly untouched.

title.children: A subterranean wonderland lies beneath the Nullarbor. A battle between energy and the environment looms in its future

image.altText: Two female teachers stand outside during a rally, posing for a photo with a sign reading 'teacher burnout' in red.

props.synopsis: Thousands of WA public school teachers walk off the job for the first time in more than a decade in a bid for better pay and working conditions.

title.children: 'We can't teach': Public school teachers abandon WA classrooms for half-day strike in pay row

image.altText: A man walks through journalists and cameras.

props.synopsis: The documents reveal Bruce Lehrmann refused an offer to settle with Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson before his failed defamation case began hearings. In a submission to the Federal Court, Mr Lehrmann argues he should be compensated for his legal costs, stating Ten embarked on a qualified privilege defence which was "bound to fail".

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann refused offer to settle defamation action with Ten before trial began, court documents reveal

image.altText: A man in a hospital gown with his leg elevated.

props.synopsis: Augustin Sanchez says he tried not to show fear during an agonising paddle back to shore as blood streamed from a shark bite wound.

title.children: Surfer's tendons torn in shark bite at popular WA surfing spot

image.altText: A profile image of a woman with long, ice blonde hair. She has a slight smile on her face.

props.synopsis: NSW man Daniel Billings has faced court charged with murdering childcare worker Molly Ticehurst, 28. Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the government will look at "every measure" to stop the "horrifying" rates of violence against women.

title.children: Man charged with murdering Molly Ticehurst was on bail for charges of rape, stalking, court hears

image.altText: Four women stand outside a courthouse holding a document.

props.synopsis: The NSW State Coroner finds racism tainted an "inexplicably deficient" police investigation into the 1987 deaths of two Indigenous girls.

title.children: Racism tainted investigation into 1987 deaths of Aboriginal teenagers, coroner finds

image.altText: Composite image of spears and a young man.

props.synopsis: Four spears stolen by Captain James Cook and his crew after he arrived at Botany Bay more than 250 years ago are handed back to traditional owners at a ceremony in England, in what is among the most significant repatriations of Indigenous objects to date.

title.children: 'Emotional moment' as spears taken by Captain Cook are returned to Indigenous community

image.altText: Elon Musk between the Twitter and X logos.

props.synopsis: There has been no shortage of criticism from across the political aisle levelled at tech billionaire Elon Musk for refusing to take down graphic footage in a Sydney church. But this spat is about more than just free speech; it's about power.

title.children: Elon Musk's fight with Australian regulators isn't really about the Sydney church attack, or even free speech. It's about power

image.altText: A composite image of three people who look like they are aged in their 20s.

props.synopsis: A coroner finds Isaiah Dixon, Bree-Anna Thomas and Thomas Courto's drownings off Tasmania's north-west coast to be "wholly avoidable".

title.children: Alcohol, meth and failure to take basic safety precautions behind Wynyard boating deaths, coroner finds

image.altText: People crowd around a helicopter that has crashed on the ground.

props.synopsis: Malaysia's navy says two military helicopters have collided and crashed during a rehearsal, killing everyone on board.

title.children: Ten killed after two Malaysian navy helicopters collide mid-air

image.altText: Smiling woman breastfeeding her baby on a brown leather couch. She has a white muslin draped over her shoulder.

props.synopsis: We spoke to mothers to hear about their experiences of taking their breastfed babies to live gigs such as the theatre and concerts, including one who welcomes babies at shows of her own.

title.children: 'I thought we were past this': Mums share their experiences of taking breastfed babies to live gigs

image.altText: A woman reads a piece of paper

props.synopsis: There is not one property across Australia that is affordable to someone on youth allowance, as experts call for the federal government to build 25,000 homes a year for the next two decades to ease the crisis.

title.children: 'Nothing short of horrifying': Rental affordability in Australia the worst it's ever been, report says

image.altText: Couple smiles and holds hands on their wedding day, professional shot of woman with red hair up-do and wedding dress

props.synopsis: Horace Monching was getting ready for bed when he heard a noise outside. It was his neighbour, allegedly wielding a chainsaw, a court has heard. A tussle ensued, resulting in traumatic injuries.

title.children: Alleged victim fought off chainsaw-wielding neighbour with croquet mallet after dog dispute, court hears

image.altText: Muddy and rocky ground in foreground with water and land in distance

props.synopsis: An investigation has been launched a member of the public made the discovery on the weekend.

title.children: Human skull found near remote Kimberley community

image.altText: Supermarket specials

props.synopsis: Research from consumer group Choice suggests some price labels at major supermarkets are misleading consumers, who believe they are receiving discounts when they are not.

title.children: Supermarket promotional labels accused of 'confusing' and 'potentially misleading' shoppers

image.altText: Baby sleeping on hospital bed

props.synopsis: The West Australian County Health Service says more than 100 cases of RSV have been recorded in the Kimberley over the past month, compared to a monthly average of 20-30.

title.children: Struggling to breathe and 'really out of it', baby Isabelle's RSV trauma prompts a mother's warning

image.altText: A woman in a bright red top stands in front of a camera inside a stadium

props.synopsis: ABC News South Asia bureau chief leaves India after being told a routine visa extension would be denied due to her reports on Sikh separatists.

title.children: 'It felt too difficult to do my job': ABC journalist targeted by Indian government over her reporting

image.altText: Lines of solar panels on a paddock

props.synopsis: A five-hour drive from Sydney, a community garden of sorts has sprouted. But instead of sharing tomatoes or lettuce, "gardeners" harvest solar energy. And it's already a hit with people otherwise excluded from the rooftop solar boom.

title.children: On a patch of earth 'big as a Bunnings car park', renters get to muscle in on the solar boom

image.altText: A crowd of people bathed in red light stand in a street at night.

props.synopsis: Fairfield Local Court heard Nikolaj Mikic had turned himself into police after investigators released images of 12 men they believed were involved in a riot outside the Christ The Good Shepherd Church. Mr Mikic is the fourth man charged over the violent riots.

title.children: Man who allegedly used a ladder to try and break into Wakeley church after stabbing of bishop is charged

image.altText: A woman in a blazer stands behind nicotine and vaping products in front of the KidSafe sign

props.synopsis: Children under five are increasingly being put at risk of nicotine poisoning because of the availability of vapes and e-cigarettes, child accident prevention authorities in South Australia have warned.

title.children: 'Treat your nicotine products like you would any other poison': Rise in poisons hotline calls prompts warning

image.altText: Court sketch of lawyers speaking as Donald Trump sits and listens in a court room

props.synopsis: A prosecutor lays out the "Trump Tower conspiracy", the former president's lawyers argue he's "cloaked in innocence", and a former titan of tabloid media educates jurors on chequebook journalism at the historic hush money trial in New York.

title.children: 'While salacious, does not matter': Porn star's claim under courtroom scrutiny as jurors hear openings in Trump's trial

image.altText: Thomas Sewell and Jacob Hersant standing next to each other on the steps outside the Victorian Court of Appeal.

props.synopsis: Thomas Sewell and Jacob Hersant avoid further jail time after they were convicted of a 2021 attack on hikers at a Victorian state park. Prosecutors appealed their sentence claiming it was "inadequate", but today lost.

title.children: 'Counter-productive' to send neo-Nazi back to jail over Victorian hiker attack, appeal court rules

image.altText: An older woman sitting in her home lounge room looking concerned

props.synopsis: Tracey Rawlings says she doesn't know if she can be alone again after a 36-year-old man with a rifle walked into her home demanding her car.

title.children: 'It was just surreal': Woman recounts gunman's home invasion in lead-up to fatal shooting by police

image.altText: A man speaks into a microphone on a foreign television channel

props.synopsis: Less than a month after Port Hedland councillor Adrian McRae made national headlines by endorsing Russia's election process, a motion of no confidence in him fails at a special council meeting.

title.children: No confidence motions fails against Port Hedland councillor who praised 'transparent' Russian election

image.altText: A group of people climb a small hill in a line, under banana trees.

props.synopsis: Charlie Lynn led trekkers across the rugged Kokoda Track for three decades — but after one trip last year, he decided the mountainous trail had fallen too far into disrepair for him to return.

title.children: After 101 treks across the Kokoda Track, one guide says it's too full of 'death traps' to go back

image.altText: Woman packing boxes on living room floor, with glass bottles and a white vase beside one cardboard box.

props.synopsis: Do you have an "escape fund"? Readers wrote in to share how having money set aside to leave a relationship has helped them.

title.children: 'I just used an escape fund to leave my marriage': Your stories of having 'get out' money

image.altText: the outside of the building with a glass facade

props.synopsis: Crown Resorts has kept its license to run its Sydney casino after an independent commission said it was a vastly different business after a probation period.

title.children: Crown Resorts given green light to operate Sydney casino

image.altText: Senior Constable Beau Lamarre-Condon looking sideways the officer is accused of killing two young men

props.synopsis: During a short mention of the case today, Downing Centre Local Court heard a partial brief of evidence has been served.

title.children: Beau Lamarre-Condon's lawyer unsure how client will plead on Jesse Baird and Luke Davies murder charges

image.altText: The PM speaking in front of a dark blue curtain.

props.synopsis: A federal senator has shared the unedited violent footage of the Wakeley church stabbing attack as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Elon Musk feud over X's bid to be able to host it on its site.

title.children: 'Ego, arrogance': PM responds to Elon Musk's comments goading him as senator posts graphic content

image.altText: Daniel Coward, Helen O'Sullivan and Surya McEwen standing side by side.

props.synopsis: Just weeks after aid worker Zomi Frankcom was killed, three Australians are participating in an unauthorised mission to deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza. As they sail to the coastal enclave, the government urges Australians "not to try and break the naval blockade".

title.children: Three Australian activists are sailing into a war zone. They think having the world's eyes on them will keep them safe

image.altText: Two young people smiling in a field.

props.synopsis: Scientist Dr Lorelle Stanisic could not help but notice an envious look on Robert's face several years ago when a new species of snail was named after his sister Bindi.

title.children: Irwin sibling rivalry comes out of shell after scientists' snail discoveries

image.altText: Collage of Coachella performers Lil Nas X, Doja Cat, Blur's Damon Albarn and Sabrina Carpenter

props.synopsis: Special guests, broken feet, saucy lyrical nods - here's everything that went down at Coachella 2024's second weekend.

title.children: Surprises, injuries, NSFW lyrics: the best (and worst) of Coachella week two

image.altText: A fiery graphic reads "VS" with an image of Drake on the left and Kendrick Lamar the right

props.synopsis: Why are rap's biggest names fighting? And why is that good business for everyone involved? Here's your answers.

title.children: Drake and Kendrick Lamar's feud has dragged in everyone from The Weeknd to Taylor Swift and AI Snoop Dogg
